subSubSection.paragraph:
Basionym:
Aerides ampullacea Roxb., Fl. Ind.
ed. 1832 , 3: 476, 1832.

Homotypic synonyms:
Saccolabium ampullaceum (Roxb.) Lindl., Sert. Orchid .
: t. 17, 1838.

Spec. Nov. Regni Veg. Beih.
1: 975, 1914.

Heterotypic synonyms:

-Grow. Man. , ed. 4: 257, 1871. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District , imp.
Williams s.n.
( holotype : not located)
.

Rollisson s.n.
( holotype : not located).

Distribution:— Northern India , the Himalayas, Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern China .

Vanda bensonii
Bateman, Bot. Mag.
92: t. 5611, 1866. Type :— MYANMAR . Bago Region : Pyay District ,
Benson s.n.
, cult.
Veitch s.n.
( holotype : K; isotype: W-R 45788 )

Vanda petersiana
auct. non Schltr.: Seidenf., Opera Bot. 95: 200−201, fig. 123c−f, 1988.

Specimens examined:— ?
MYANMAR . 1867,

.

SHAN . Unspecified :
Lynch s.n.
( K ), det. Kiat Tan ; Taunggyi District :
1370 m
,
22 Apr 1939
,
Dickason 8278
( AMES , K )
.
BAGO . Pyay District : type . YANGON . Unspecified :
Woodall s.n.
( K ), det. Kiat Tan. MON. Mawlamyine District , Parish 204 (not located), fide Parish (1883: 198) . WITHOUT LOCALITY. Cult. material ( W )
[3 collections];
Doring 5578
( M )
.
Reported from Tanintharyi Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 89)
, but we have not seen material from this area
.
Distribution:— Myanmar and Thailand .

Notes:— Generally the lip of this species has patent, flattish epichile lobules, but a couple of collections ( Doring 5578, Dickason 8278 ) have lobules that are recurved. These specimens are not
V. petersiana
since that has rounded side lobes and linear epichile lobules. In the western part of Mandalay Region , the species apparently forms hybrid swarms with
V. brunnea
and
V. liouvillei (
Tanaka et al. 2015: 87
)
. It was pointed out ‘collections of the three species in this list may include natural hybrids among them’.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Vanda brunnea Rchb.
f.,
Xenia Orchid.
2: 138, 1868. Type :— MYANMAR . Kayin State : Myawaddy District , 1864,
Parish 177
( lectotype K, designated by
Seidenfaden 1988: 201
; icon. K, W)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Heterotypic synonym:
Vanda denisoniana Benson & Rchb.
f.
var. hebraica Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron. , n.s., 24: 39, 1885. Types:—ORIGIN UNKNOWN (probably Myanmar). Ex Rimann s.n. , cult. Williams s.n. ( syntype : W); MYANMAR . Mon State: Mawlamyine District, icon. Rimann s.n. ( syntype : W).

Specimens examined:— ? MYANMAR . Type ; 1867, Parish s.n. (icon. K & W ). KACHIN . Putao District: 915 m , 23 Mar 1953 , Kingdon-Ward 22061 p.p. ( BM ), det. L . M . Gardiner et al . CHIN . Falam District: 1525−2130 m , comm. 9 Oct 1923 , Daun 3 ( K ), ident. uncertain. MANDALAY . Myingyan District: 21 Mar 2006 , Khin Myo Htwe 97 ( MBK [s]), fide
Tanaka et al. (2015: 87)
; same loc., 3 May 2006 , Khin Myo Htwe 16 ( TNS [s]), fide
Tanaka et al. (2015: 87)
. KAYIN . Myawaddy District: type . MON. Mawlamyine District: type ; same loc., 1874, Parish s.n. ( W ). Also reported from Shan State by
Kress et al. (2003: 89)
, but we have not seen material from this area.
Distribution:— Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern China .

Note:— See comment on natural hybrids under
V. bensonii
.

Vanda
×
charlesworthii Rolfe, Orchid Rev.
2: 322, 1894. Types:— MYANMAR . Without locality, 16 Oct 1894 , cult. Low s.n. ( lectotype K, designated here). Syntype : Cult. Charlesworth s.n. (not located)

Heterotypic synonym:
Vanda fleuryi Rolfe, Gard. Chron.
, ser. 3, 48: 320, 1910 [as floryae ].

Specimens examined:—
SHAN . Unspecified :
Jul 1896
, cult. Moore s.n. ( K ). WITHOUT
LOCALITY. Types ;
Feb 1902
, cult.
Cypher s.n.
( K ); cult. Lackner s.n. ( K );
3 Jun 1918
, cult. RBG Kew s.n. ( K )
.
Distribution:— Endemic.

Note:— A natural hybrid between
V. bensonii
and
V. coerulea .
